intro: Achrouteria, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiky flower heads and silvery-gray foliage. Achrouteria species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their hardy nature and aesthetic appeal. They play a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion in coastal regions.
